definition: A term commonly employed to refer to individuals who have inhabited a particular region or area since ancient times, often denoting the indigenous or native population.

examples.german: Die Ureinwohner Australiens sind die Aborigines.
examples.english: The indigenous people of Australia are the Aborigines.

examples.german: Die Ureinwohner Amerikas werden auch als Indianer bezeichnet.
examples.english: The indigenous people of America are also referred to as Indians.
The indigenous people of New Zealand are called Maori.

examples.german: Die Ureinwohner Kanadas sind die First Nations.
examples.english: The indigenous people of Canada are the First Nations.

examples.german: Die Ureinwohner Afrikas haben eine reiche kulturelle Vielfalt.
examples.english: The indigenous people of Africa have a rich cultural diversity.
